title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The solution curve must pass through the point ( 2,  0.5 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaqadaqaaabaaa aaaaaapeGaaGOmaiaacYcacaaMc8UaaGPaVlaaicdacaGGUaGaaGyn aaWdaiaawIcacaGLPaaapeGaaiilaaaa@4222@ extend reasonably close (within one row or column of the edge of the slope field) to the left edge and top-right corner of the square, and have no obvious conflicts with the given slope lines.

Do not consider any portion of the solution curve that extends beyond the square.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The tangent line equation can be presented in any equivalent form.

A response with incorrect tangent line equation with a slope of 3 will not earn the first point but earns the second point for a consistent approximation.

A response of only 0.5+3( 2.4−2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlai aaiwdacqGHRaWkcaaIZaWaaeWaaeaacaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaisdacqGH sislcaaIYaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@4225@ earns the second point but not the first.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point a response must present work to support f ″ (2)=7. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA2@

The minimal supporting work is d 2 y d x 2 =1+2 dy dx . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AD@

The expression f ″ (2) 2! ( x−2 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C0@ will earn the second point even if a value of f ″ (2) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C29@ is never presented. If an incorrect value of f ″ (2) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C29@ is presented, it must be nonzero in order to earn the second point.

The third point is for adding the tangent line expression and an expression (such as f ″ (2) 2! ( x−2 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C0@ or 7 2 ( x−2 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA1@ ) which has earned the second point.

· An incorrect tangent line expression may be imported from part (b).

· Numeric values of f(2),  f ′ (2), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41F2@ and f ″ (2) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C29@ must be included in the polynomial expression in order to earn the third point.

· A correct second-degree polynomial followed by “ +… MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHRaWkcqWIMaYsaaa@3B00@ ” can earn the third point provided the response uses only the second-degree polynomial in calculating the approximation.

· A response that includes additional terms in a presented polynomial will not earn the third point, but is eligible for the fourth point provided the approximation is found using only the second-degree polynomial.

An answer of just 0.5+3( 0.4 )+ 7 2 ( 0.4 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4783@ earns only the fourth point.

A response that presents an incorrect approximation will earn the fourth point if it has earned the third point and correctly evaluates the presented (incorrect) second-degree Taylor polynomial about x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaaaa@3BBB@ at x=2.4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DDD@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all four of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

· The minimal response to earn the first point is ( max f ‴ (x) )⋅ 0.4 3 3! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47AD@ or 36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@453F@

· In order to earn the second point, a response must indicate that |  f( 2.4 )− P 2 ( 2.4 )  |≤36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! <0.5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5B6D@ Error bound=36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! <0.5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5355@ or Error≤36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! <0.5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4EBC@
A response that only shows 36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! <0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47BC@ does not earn the second point.

A response that equates the error with the bound (e.g., Error=36 ⋅  0.4 3 3! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A2C@ ) does not earn the second point.
